results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.

results.title: The Mystery of the Taj Mahal
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Duroux, Barry Stoner and Stoner Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Treasures of the world”.
A detailed documentary focussing on one of the most recogniseable monuments in the world, the Taj Mahal. Built during the mogul period when outrageous opulence became symbolic of one’s power, the Taj Mahal was created by the distraught emperor Shahjahan as a tribute to his beloved consort Arjumand Banu, better known as Mumtaz Mahal, after she died of complications from the birth of her fourteenth child. Using materials sourced from every corner of the globe, the Taj Mahal - which took over twenty years to build - features a stunning array of architectural forms, the origins of which are discussed in detail. The historical, artistic, and religious significance of the Taj Mahal are also examined, utilising archival material and the expertise of art historians Milo Beach and Shabita Punja.

results.title: The mystery of the pictures: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Jackie Cockle, Ellen Meske and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES, TIMOTHY’S GUEST, LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG, KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY and TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK. THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES: The animals take some pictures with Timothy’s Polaroid camera and are surprised when dark shapes appear in them. While trying to solve the mystery the animals discover an unexpected visitor living opposite their shelf. TIMOTHY’S GUEST: The animals have a new friend to play with when Timothy offers to look after his cousin’s dog for the weekend. LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG: While Timothy is off playing golf the animals search for birds’ nests in Bluebell Wood. Little Mut finds what he is looking for as well as an unexpected visitor. KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY: It seems like Kinker’s holiday is about to turn into one big disaster, but with a little help from the animals and their invention of a home made telephone system, things may turn out alright. TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK: The animals help Timothy with his homework and do such a good job that Timothy wins a prize.

results.title: The Mystery of Oberwald = Il Mistero Di Oberwald
results.brief_description: Since her husband’s death ten years ago the Queen has been mournful, reclusive and obsessed with her own death. She offers refuge for three days to a man who attempts to kill her: she warns him ‘ If you do not kill me, I’ll kill you’. However, he bears a ghost-like resemblance to the dead king and quickly her passion and love for life is rekindled. The final twist in this remarkable picture will leave you drenched with compassion and only then will you know the mystery of Oberwald. From the play by Jean Cocteau.

results.title: The Mysterious Mr Tesla
results.brief_description: It was Tesla, not Edison, who invented the method of transmitting electricity which makes the 20th century work. In the 1890s Tesla also demonstrated the wireless two years before Marconi. Now a growing number of Tesla enthusiasts claim that his later research was 80 years ahead of its time.

results.title: The Mysterious bee (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Simon Nature Films, Australian Film Commission and Phil Simon
results.brief_description: Through the use of macro photography and slow motion filming, Phil Simon takes the viewer into the world of the honey bee. We see, first hand, the life cycle of the drone, the worker and the queen bee and their roles and interaction with each other in the colony. A highlight of the video is the fight to the death of two queen bees. Advice is also given on how to keep and handle bees.

results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Mysteries of Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: Anne James and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The extraordinary paintings of Hieronymus Bosch, painted over 400 years ago, continue to haunt and disturb us to such an extent that there is constant argument about their meaning. Dr Nicholas Baum presents an unusual detective story as he tries to unravel the mysteries of the man about whom so little is known.
